name: Hydro Powerhouse
title: Leading in Renewable Energy
description: In 2021, Bhutan produced 100% of its electricity from renewable sources, with 99.99% coming from hydroelectric power, making it a global leader in sustainable energy production.

name: Debt Dilemma
title: High External Debt Burden
description: As of 2023, Bhutan's external debt stands at 332.14% of its exports of goods, services, and primary income, indicating a significant financial challenge.

name: Trade Ties
title: Strong Regional Trade Relations
description: In 2023, 95.89% of Bhutan's merchandise exports and 91.50% of imports were with low- and middle-income economies in South Asia, highlighting robust regional trade connections.

name: Efficient Licensing
title: Quick Business Licensing
description: In 2015, Bhutan required only 1.2 days to obtain an operating license, showcasing its efficient business environment.

name: Corruption Control
title: Low Corruption Levels
description: With only 0.1% of firms reporting informal payments to public officials in 2015, Bhutan demonstrates strong governance and low corruption.

name: Regulatory Hurdles
title: Time-Consuming Regulations
description: In 2015, senior management in Bhutan spent 28.8% of their time dealing with government regulations, indicating a need for streamlined processes.

name: Intellectual Property Outflow
title: Negative Intellectual Property Receipts
description: In 2024, Bhutan had a negative balance of $8,581.42 in charges for the use of intellectual property, suggesting an outflow of intellectual property payments.

name: IMF Dependency
title: Reliance on IMF Credit
description: In 2023, Bhutan's use of IMF credit amounted to $34.27 million, indicating a reliance on international financial support.
